Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2009 07:10PM BJ09 wrote: So I saw the surgeon today and he said he wasnt comfortable classifying it as Fibrocystic just yet considering family history.  He wants me to call him back on Monday, when he should have my MRI results (MRI is Friday).  The disk the image center gave me to give the surgeon with the US and Mamo pictures didnt work in his computer.  So he had nothing to read other than the reports.  He indicated that the report indicated that they were focusing on the 3 o'clock position of my left breast not at the 1 o'clock where I and he felt the lump.  So a little more waiting for me.

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2009 07:44AM BJ09 wrote: Hi I'm new here.  I went for a mamo last Tuesday, saw my dr on Wed, and discussed a lump I found on my left breast.  Dr thought it might be a fibroid/cyst (which I've been told in the past).  Dr recommends I see a surgeon just to be safe.  Thurs I get a call that the radiologist wants me to have more testing (which is this Thurs) and I see the surgeon the following week.  I'm worried because I have lost 3 family members to breast cancer and the fact that they are scheduling my appts rather quickly.  In speaking with others I've yet to hear of appts getting scheduled this quickly.  Has anyone here had appts scheduled that quickly?  Am I worrying for nothing?
Posts.Title: worried with these symptoms.. chekwa LynnW

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2009 09:57AM BJ09 wrote: So I just had my digital mamogram and my ultrasound this morning.  I cannot believe how painful they both were. I have a high tolerance for pain, but good lord that hurt and now I'm very sore.  So the radiologist said they did not see anything worrisome but did recommend an MRI to be sure, and to still see the surgeon.  Thank you to all for the thoughts and prayers, and my thoughts and prayers are with everyone as well.
